question: What is the main use of ETD fragmentation?
ideal_answer: Electron-based fragmentation methods have revolutionized biomolecular mass spectrometry, in particular native and top-down protein analysis.

snippets.text: Electron transfer dissociation (ETD) is an analytically useful tool for primary structure interrogation of intact proteins, but its utility is limited by higher-order reactions with the products.
Electron-based fragmentation methods have revolutionized biomolecular mass spectrometry, in particular native and top-down protein analysis.
nalyzed with less conventional mass spectrometry, i.e. using Electron Transfer Dissociation (ETD) for analyte fragmentation
Using a longer than normal electron transfer dissociation (ETD) reaction time, we obtained enhanced coverage of peptide bonds that facilitated the localization of O-glycosites
